channel.title: What's Your Inspiration?
channel.description:
You know I was thinking about this the other day. I'm sure all of us, when working on that project that we've been working on forever. We lose motivation every now and then (maybe even forever?). Or we're tired of reading that book, and we lose motivation. Call me weird, but this happens to me quite a bit.
So I'm curious, who/what's your inspiration, or what keeps you going?
Personally, when I come across this, I tend to watch time-lapse videos of people just working on programming. It motivates me, because that's what I love to do. A person I also look up too a lot is Notch (Minecraft Founder/Creator).

item.title: What's Your Inspiration?
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:8, topic:413142”]My inspiration? I seriously pull ideas from thin air lol. I wont work on something from inspiration unless there is something from it I feel i need to learn. My 2d game was almost scrapped after I found simular arcade game shortly after getting the basics done.

My motivation? Well, I only program when I am bored. I only ever got into rsps because I had just moved cross country to finish school. Had no friends then, so I needing something to wadte time with. Now that I moved back, have a gf and friends. Along with 4 motorcycles and 2 vehicles it is hard to get bored. I have found myself only getting bored on the days I just get payed. So I have nearly stopped doing shit on the computer in general.

Rambled a bit there, sorry lol. I think that covers it. But yea, inspiration and motivation are 2 different things. th 4 motorcycles and 2 vehicles it is hard to get bored. I have found myself only getting bored on the days I just get payed. So I have nearly stopped doing shit on the computer in general.

Rambled a bit there, sorry lol. I think that covers it. But yea, inspiration and motivation are 2 different things.[/quote]

Umm…what happened with the last 2 paragraphs lol?

Read full topic

item.title: What's Your Inspiration?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I think motivation and inspiration are completely different worlds. I’ve been inspired to do dozens of projects, but hardly motivated to finish any of them. I’ve personally reached a stage where I have realized motivation can be as simple as saying no when I get bored with a project, and just continue working on it. Just focus on finishing it, no matter how boring it gets. It’s fine to take breaks, but I would personally not advising taking a break longer than a few weeks or month, at max, because you will most likely turn months into years and end up never finishing it.

Another perspective is looking at it like a job. Jobs are easy to become motivated at because you are rendering services and receiving a tangible reward, in most cases, a monetary one. In hobbies (seems especially virtual hobbies), when there is no tangible reward then even after you spend hours and hours working on a project, it doesn’t seem like an accomplishment when you’re done. So maybe look at it like a job, and try to come up with things you will gain when you finish it, so you can feel accomplished and have a purpose for doing it in the first place.

Heh, that was kinda rambly, but I hope I got my point across.

Read full topic
